subject: History
title: The Meiji Restoration
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Meiji Restoration usable.

hook.text: In 1868, Japan leapt from medieval feudalism to modern industrial power in one generation. No nation changed faster.

buildup.text: When American warships forced Japan open in 1853, samurai realized their medieval system couldn't resist Western power.

discovery.text: Young reformers overthrew the shogun and restored Emperor Meiji as a symbol of unity and modernization.

twist.text: Japan didn't just adopt Western technologyâ€”it sent students worldwide and redesigned its entire government and army.

climax.text: By 1905, Japan defeated Russia in warâ€”the first Asian nation to beat a European power in modern history.

punchline.text: A medieval country became a modern empire in 40 years.

quiz.question: What event triggered Japan's decision to modernize rapidly?
options: A devastating earthquake that destroyed Tokyo
American warships forced Japan to open to trade
A civil war between rival samurai clans
